ContentClassification.TableReference: Australian Government Actuary, “Australian Life Tables: 1995-97”, Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (1999). Accessed: February, 2014 from http://www.aga.gov.au/publications/downloads/ALT1995-97.pdf
ContentClassification.TableDescription: 1995-1997 Australian Life Tables – Males. Minimum Age: 0 Maximum Age: 109
ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: Based on the 1996 Census of Population and Housing adjusted for under-enumeration and lapse of time between June 30 and date the census was taken, Number of deaths taken from January, 1995 to December, 1997. Number of births for January 1991 through December 1977 was used to refine rates at the very young ages (less than 3 years of age). Methodology: Crude mortality rates calculated by dividing the number of deaths at a particular age by the exposed-to-risk for that age. Base estimate of exposed-to-risk taken as 1/8 * P(x-2) + 7/8 * P(x-1) + P(x) + 7/8 * P(x+1) + 1/8* P(x+2). This formula smoothes to some extent the fluctuations from age to age apparent in the unadjusted population count. Special handling accorded ages 0 to 2 and ages above 98. As with previous tables, graduation of the crude mortality rates was done by a combination of manual graduation and fitted cubic splines. NOTE: With the publication of the 1995-97 tables, the data was made available in electronic format (Excel Spreadsheet). To allow historical comparison, the mortality rates for ages 0 to 100 from previous reports were included as well. Regrettably, duplicate entries in the Society of Actuaries’ Table Database then ensued. These duplicate entries have been removed. Furthermore, as the Excel spreadsheet truncated all tables at age 100, when available, the original published report from the Government Actuary has been relied upon. If the Government Actuary publication was not readily accessible, the values from the Excel Spreadsheet have been used. Data Transcription Errors: None. Data Certified: 02/2014

MetaData.TableDescription: 1995-1997 Australian Life Tables – Males. Minimum Age: 0 Maximum Age: 109
